We will have an at-large school board seat open effective August 1, 2020. Eligible candidates must be at least 18 years of age and a resident of the Pella Community School District.

This seat is currently held by Gregg Gustafson, who is resigning from the school board after 11 years of service. There are 15 months left on the elected term for this position, which expires November of 2021. At that time, the appointed candidate can choose to run for another four years.

If you are interested in collaborating with stakeholders to create a shared vision and foster a positive learning culture, consider applying for this school board position. Please contact Greg Ebeling or Joan Corbin for more information.

November 22, 2019 at 10:00 AM ·

This fall a fashion class from Pella Schools worked on a class project to turn old jeans into reusable bags to use during food distribution for families we serve in Haiti. Families will be able to use these bags for many different purposes beyond food distribution. Thank you to these students for serving and blessing the people we serve in Haiti!

post_text: Madison Elementary Mileage Club completed its seventh year with record-breaking success! Mileage Club is a program promoted by PE teacher Katie Gravert to give every Madison student the opportunity to be active and set goals by running during lunch recess. The 2017-2018 school year was a milestone year with students running a combined 3,795 miles, the most ever at Madison Elementary! One hundred and forty-one different students ran 10 or more miles. Ten students were honored at the year-end assembly with t-shirts from Franklin Street Clothing for running over 70 miles throughout the year. The top Mileage Club runner, Max Stelpflug, ran 115 miles. A special thank you to parent volunteers who make Mileage Club possible and congratulations to our top Milers for the year!

Jefferson Intermediate Book Fair

With a theme of “Paws for Reading,” Jefferson staff set up activities around the school in conjunction with the Buy one, Get one Free book fair. “We do this fair to get books in the hands of students at a discounted price, and adding the literacy activities allowed teachers to make bookmarks, play games, read with families, and have fun with students outside of the school day,” said Teacher Librarian Paula Winward. With the help of Pella Rolscreen and the literacy night volunteers we were also able to make sure every student that attended received a free book as well. We had over 70 families attend the activities and many more visited the book fair before the activities began. The book fair helped get over 1600 books in the hands of students at a discounted price.

Congratulations to Eric Nelson!

Eric Nelson has been selected to receive the 2018 Iowa Bandmasters Association Outstanding Administrator Award. The Iowa Bandmasters Association selects administrators who exhibit leadership traits supporting the growth and success of band programs, students, directors, and school communities.

Pella High School band director Dameon Place nominated Eric for the award stating in his letter that: “Eric is diligent in supporting our efforts to be the best we can be. Eric will be presented with the award at the Iowa Bandmasters Awards Banquet on May 11, 2018.

Joe Burch, PE teacher at Jefferson, has been talking about and will continue to discuss "making mistakes." If you've never seen the show Dude Perfect it is basically videos of trick shots. Many of the students at Jefferson have seen these shows so I thought it would be fun to create our own. The goal was to attempt difficult challenges and compile some of the success (and a few bloopers) in the final product. I think we had a lot of fun with these challenges, even though some students had to attempt the challenge many times before finding success. Others never successfully completed the challenge. The point was to see if students could embrace difficult situations and have fun even when making mistakes. We all make mistakes and I feel as long as we learn from them and learn to not be afraid of "failing" we are on the right track. Our students are perfect enough in my book and I really enjoyed the long process of making these videos.
